plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A perennial bulbous plant known for its early bright and colorful cup-shaped flowers emerging from the ground often through snow, signaling early spring in temperate climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late winter to early spring (February to April)
plants.funFact: Crocuses are among the first flowers to bloom after winter, often poking through late snow, making them a traditional symbol of new beginnings.

plants.name: Mahonia aquifolium
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with holly-like leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers appearing in early spring, providing nectar for early pollinators.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late winter to early spring (February to March)
plants.funFact: Mahonia flowers are an important early nectar source for bees emerging after winter dormancy.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: A fast-growing tree known for its fragrant, bright yellow, fluffy flower clusters that bloom in late winter, heralding spring in Mediterranean and subtropical climates.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, Australia, and subtropical regions
plants.funFact: The yellow blooms of Acacia dealbata are traditionally celebrated in many Mediterranean countries during winter festivals.

plants.name: Winter Jasmine (Jasminum nudiflorum)
plants.description: A deciduous shrub producing bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers directly on green arching stems during the winter months when few other plants bloom.
plants.location: China and widely cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Winter Jasmine flowers on bare green stems before leaves appear, making it very distinctive and valuable for winter color in gardens.
